variant.name: .BackGesture
variant.summary: Metrics related to back gesture's nudes and usage.

variant.name: .HomeToOverview
variant.summary: Metrics related to home to overview gesture's nudes and usage.

variant.name: .InAppToHome
variant.summary: Metrics related to in app to home gesture's nudes and usage.

variant.name: .ClamshellMode
variant.summary: Normal clamshell mode with multiple windows animates

variant.name: .MinimizedTabletMode
variant.summary: Animates in Tablet mode w/o split view and all windows are minimized

variant.name: .SingleClamshellMode
variant.summary: In Clamshell mode with only top maximized/fullscren window animates

variant.name: .TabletMode
variant.summary: Animates in Tablet mode w/o split view

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.Deprecated.ShowImeMenuBubble
histogram.summary: Showing the IME menu bubble has two accelerators: - Alt+Shift+K which is deprecated. - Search+Shift+K which is new. This histogram shows the number of times each accelerator (deprecated and new) is used.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.Deprecated.ShowTaskManager
histogram.summary: Opening the task manager has two accelerators: - Shift+Esc which is deprecated. - Search+Esc which is new. This histogram shows the number of times each accelerator (deprecated and new) is used.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.Deprecated.ToggleHighContrast
histogram.summary: Toggling the high contrast display mode has two accelerators: - Search+Shift+H which is deprecated. - Ctrl+Search+H which is new. This histogram shows the number of times each accelerator (deprecated and new) is used.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.Rotation.Usage
histogram.summary: Captures the result of a user using the rotation accelerator - Ctrl+Shift+Refresh. This histogram shows how frequently users accidentally hit the key combination.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.WindowSnap
histogram.summary: Captures usage of Alt+[ and Alt+].

histogram.name: Ash.ActiveWindowShowTypeOverTime
histogram.summary: The show type of the active window tracked over time by logging on a regular basis (30 minutes).

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.Activation.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever Ambient mode is entered from {TabletOrClamshell}. AmbientUiMode indicates whether the user entered Ambient mode from the lock screen or from screen idle.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.AnimationSmoothness.PhotoTransition
histogram.summary: Emitted when the ambient mode photo transition animation completes to report the smoothness of this animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.Enabled
histogram.summary: Among eligible users, whether the user has Ambient mode enabled. Recorded once for every UMA upload. The set of eligible users includes all users with profiles that can allow Ambient mode to be enabled. This is limited by profile type, whether the user is primary, if the user has a supported email, etc.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.EngagementTime.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Among eligible users with ambient mode enabled, records the length of each session. The metric is uploaded when ambient mode is ended.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.PhotoSource
histogram.summary: Among eligible users with ambient mode enabled, records the source of ambient mode photos. Recorded once for every UMA upload.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.SelectedNumberOfAlbums
histogram.summary: Among eligible users with ambient mode enabled, records the selected number of personal photo albums. Recorded once only when users make a selection on the personal photo albums on Settings page.

histogram.name: Ash.AmbientMode.TotalNumberOfAlbums
histogram.summary: Among eligible users with ambient mode enabled, records the total number of personal photo albums. Recorded once only when users make a selection on the personal photo albums on Settings page.

histogram.name: Ash.AppNotificationBadgingPref
histogram.summary: For each user, records whether they have the app notification badging user preference enabled or disabled. This metric is only logged when an active user session has been started. This metric is logged periodically every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Assistant.AnimationSmoothness{AshAssistantAnimationSmoothness}
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of assistant related animations. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. {AshAssistantAnimationSmoothness}

variant.obsolete: Base histogram. Use suffixes of this histogram instead.

variant.name: .CardElement
variant.summary: Animation for showing and hiding card responses

variant.name: .SuggestionChip
variant.summary: Animation for showing and hiding suggestion chips

variant.name: .TextElement
variant.summary: Animation for showing and hiding text response

histogram.name: Ash.BackGesture.EndScenarioType
histogram.summary: End scenario type while swiping back from the left side of the window in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.BackGesture.StartScenarioType
histogram.summary: Start scenario type while swiping back from the left side of the window in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.BackGesture.UnderneathWindowType
histogram.summary: Underneath window type while swiping back from the left side of the window in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.AshDataSizeMB
histogram.summary: The size of profile data that is identified to belong to ash-chrome i.e. the total size of files that are under profile data directory of ash-chrome that should remain in the same directory.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.CommonDataSizeMB
histogram.summary: The size of profile data that is duplicated in both ash and lacros data directory.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.CommonDataTimeTakenMS
histogram.summary: The time taken for copying common data shared with lacros and ash.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.CopiedDataSizeMB
histogram.summary: The size of data copied due to the migration i.e. extra space taken up because of the migration. Only recorded if migration succeeded.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.CreateDirectoryFailure
histogram.summary: Records error if CreateDirectory failed to create a directory used to copy files into as an intermediate destination during migration.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunAshDataSizeMB
histogram.summary:
The size of profile data that is identified to belong to ash-chrome i.e. the total size of files that are under profile data directory of ash-chrome that should remain in the same directory.
The same as Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.AshDataSizeMB but collected without actually running the migrator. It is called on every ash launch.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunCommonDataSizeMB
histogram.summary:
The size of profile data that is duplicated in both ash and lacros data directory.
The same as Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.CommonDataSizeMB but collected without actually running the migrator. It is called on every ash launch.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunHasEnoughDiskSpace.{Mode}
histogram.summary:
Checks if there is enough disk space for profile migration in each modes. These modes are Copy, Move, DeleteAndCopy and DeleteAndMove.
Checked upon launch of ash-chrome.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunLacrosDataSizeMB
histogram.summary:
The size of profile data that is identified to belong to lacros-chrome i.e. the total size of files that are under profile data directory of ash-chrome that should move to lacros data directory.
The same as Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.LacrosDataSizeMB but collected without actually running the migrator. It is called on every ash launch.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.DryRunNoCopyDataSizeMB
histogram.summary:
The size of profile data that is identified to be deletable such as cache.
The same as Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.NoCopyDataSizeMB but collected without actually running the migrator. It is called on every ash launch.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.FinalStatus
histogram.summary: The final status of browser data migration. It is collected to monitor if migration is working and if not used to determine which step is failing.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.LacrosDataSizeMB
histogram.summary: The size of profile data that is identified to belong to lacros-chrome i.e. the total size of files that are under profile data directory of ash-chrome that should move to lacros data directory.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.LacrosDataTimeTakenMS
histogram.summary: The time taken for copying lacros data.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.NoCopyDataSizeMB
histogram.summary: The size of profile data that is identified to be deletable such as cache.

histogram.name: Ash.BrowserDataMigrator.TotalTimeTakenMS
histogram.summary: The time taken for migration to complete in ms. Only recorded if migration succeeded.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.BarButtons.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a button from the bar widget displayed in Capture mode is pressed in {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum value indicates the type of the button pressed.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.CaptureAudioOnMetric.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a user is in a capture mode screen recording entered from {TabletOrClamshell}. Emits true when audio is enabled, false otherwise.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.CaptureConfiguration.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a user performs a screen capture in {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum indicates the configuration used for the capture. I.e. the capture source and the capture type.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.CaptureRegionAdjusted.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a user is in a region capture session in {TabletOrClamshell} and performs a capture or they switch the capture source. The recorded count indicates the number of times the user adjusts the region. This counts each time they move the region or resize it. It is reset whenever a user creates a new region or the count is recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.ConsecutiveScreenshots
histogram.summary: Records the number of consecutive screenshots the user takes within 5s of each other, regardless of capture options.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.EndRecordingReason.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever capture mode screen recording is ended in {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum value indicates the reason that lead to ending the screen recording.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.EntryPoint.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever Capture mode is entered from {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum value indicates the method used to enter Capture mode.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.QuickAction
histogram.summary: Track all quick actions on screenshot notification. Including: Edit in backlight, Go to Files, Delete File.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.SaveToLocation.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever screen capture is saved in {TabletOrClamshell}. The recorded enum value indicates the location that the screen capture is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.ScreenRecordingLength
histogram.summary: Records the time of a successful video recording in capture mode. This metric will not be recorded if a file was not successfully saved. The upper limit of this histogram is 3 hours.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.ScreenshotsPerDay
histogram.summary: Records the number of screenshots that have been taken via the CaptureModeController every 24 hours. Note that counts are not persisted across crashes, restarts, or sessions so this is only intended to give a rough approximation.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.ScreenshotsPerWeek
histogram.summary: Records the number of screenshots that have been taken via the CaptureModeController every 7 days. Note that counts are not persisted across crashes, restarts, or sessions so this is only intended to give a rough approximation. This means that this metric will only be recorded in sessions spanning at least 7 days.

histogram.name: Ash.CaptureModeController.SwitchesFromInitialCaptureMode
histogram.summary: Emits true if a user has switched capture modes (fullscreen, region, window) while in a capture mode session, false otherwise.

histogram.name: Ash.Clipboard.ConsecutiveCopies
histogram.summary: The number of consecutive copies in the user session, recorded when a paste occurs.

histogram.name: Ash.Clipboard.ConsecutivePastes
histogram.summary: The number of consecutive pastes in the user session, recorded when a copy occurs. Includes pastes from Clipboard History.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ConsecutivePastes
histogram.summary: The number of consecutive pastes from the clipboard history menu. The count is reset after a copy or a paste that is not through the clipboard history menu (such as pressing ctrl-v accelerator or clicking at a context menu option).

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ContextMenu.DisplayFormatDeleted
histogram.summary: The format of the ClipboardHistoryItemView that was deleted from the Clipboard History menu. Logged on ClipboardHistoryItemView::ButtonPressed().

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ContextMenu.DisplayFormatPasted
histogram.summary: The format of the ClipboardHistoryItemView that was pasted from the Clipboard History menu. Logged on ClipboardHistoryItemView::ButtonPressed().

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ContextMenu.DisplayFormatShown
histogram.summary: The format of the view used to display clipboard data. Logged when the view is created.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ContextMenu.MenuOptionSelected
histogram.summary: The command ID index within the Clipboard History contextual menu that was selected by the user. Recorded when the menu item is selected.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ContextMenu.NumberOfItemsShown
histogram.summary: The number of clipboard history items shown in the clipboard history contextual menu. Recorded when the clipboard history contextual menu model is built.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ContextMenu.ShowMenu
histogram.summary: It records how many times users trigger the clipboard history menu through different ways respecitvely. Recorded when the clipboard history menu shows.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ContextMenu.ShowPlaceholderString
histogram.summary: The number of placeholder strings shown to users in lieu of actual data, broken down by placeholder string type. Recorded when the label is requested from ClipboardHistoryResourceManager.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ContextMenu.UserJourneyTime
histogram.summary: The length of the user journey of the context menu version of clipboard history. Measured as time from starting to construct the menu, to time of the menu being closed. Recorded every time the menu is closed, regardless of whether the user selected one of the menu options.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ContextualNudge.NudgeToFeatureOpenTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2021 as of http://crrev.com/2761780. This histogram entry was recreated as to some metrics may not be logging correctly. Replaced by Ash.ClipboardHistory.Nudges.OnboardingNudge.ToFeatureOpenTime.
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between the user being shown the clipboard history contextual nudge and the opening the clipboard history menu. The sum over this histogram will also be used to measure the conversion rate between showing the nudge and the clipboard history feature being opened.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ContextualNudge.NudgeToFeatureUseTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2021 as of http://crrev.com/2761780. This histogram entry was recreated as to some metrics may not be logging correctly. Replaced by Ash.ClipboardHistory.Nudges.OnboardingNudge.ToFeaturePasteTime.
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between the user being shown the clipboard history contextual nudge and the user pasting with the clipboard history feature. The sum over this histogram will also be used to measure the conversion rate between showing the nudge and the clipboard history feature being used.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ContextualNudge.ShownCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the clipboard history contextual nudge has been shown. This number will be used as the baseline against the sum of the NudgeToFeatureUseTime and NudgeToFeatureOpenTime.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ControlToVDelay
histogram.summary: The time between a user pressing control and V when pasting via keyboard. Recorded in AcceleratorHistory when a V is pressed. Only recorded for the first pressed V in a sequence, for example: User holds control, waits 200ms, presses V (histogram logged), presses V again without releasing control (no histogram logged). This metric is used to set a baseline for an experimental keyboard combination where a user holds control, then presses V after a delay to show multipaste.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ImageModelRequest.Lifetime
histogram.summary: The lifetime of the ClipboardImageModelRequest object. Logged in the dtor of ClipboardImageModelRequest.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ImageModelRequest.Runtime
histogram.summary: The runtime of a request in a ClipboardImageModelRequest. Logged from when the ClipboardImageModelRequest is Start()-ed to when it is Stop()-ed.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ImageModelRequest.StopReason
histogram.summary: The reason a ClipboardImageModelRequest is stopped. Logged when a request is Stop()-ed.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.Nudges.{NudgeType}.ShownCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the clipboard history {NudgeType} has been shown. This number will be used as the baseline against the number of emits of the ToFeaturePasteTime and ToFeatureOpenTime histograms.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.Nudges.{NudgeType}.ToFeature{Action}Time
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between the user being shown the clipboard history {NudgeType} and {Action}. The number of emits to this histogram will also be used to measure the conversion rate by comparing it to ShownCount histogram

variant.name: Paste
variant.summary: using the clipboard history to paste something

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.Operation
histogram.summary: Different operations detected by ClipboardHistory. Debounced, so different than Clipboard.Read, Clipboard.Write. Any clipboard copy detected here will result in a new entry in ClipboardHistory. Recorded after a clipboard read or write is debounced in ClipboardHistory.

histogram.name: Ash.ClipboardHistory.ZeroStateContextualNudge.ShownCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the clipboard history zero state contextual nudge has been shown. This number will be used as the baseline against the sum of the ToFeatureUseTime and ToFeatureOpenTime.

histogram.name: Ash.ContextualNudgeDismissContext{ContextualNudgesCategories}
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason contextual nudges for user gesture education are dismissed. Metrics are recorded when the user performs an action that renders the shown contextual nudge irrelevant. Metrics are recorded when the user performs the gesture suggested by the nudge as well as when the user exits the relevant state some other way. {ContextualNudgesCategories}

variant.obsolete: Base histogram. Use suffixes of this histogram instead.

histogram.name: Ash.ContextualNudgeDismissTime{ContextualNudgesCategories}
histogram.summary: Tracks time between showing contextual nudge and gesture being performed. Metrics are only recorded when the user performs the action suggested by the contextual nudge. No metrics are recorded if the user exits the relevant state some other way. {ContextualNudgesCategories}

variant.obsolete: Base histogram. Use suffixes of this histogram instead.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.AnimationSmoothness.DeskActivation
histogram.summary: Emitted when the virtual desks activation animation completes to report the smoothness of this animation when running on the display on which the active window resides (if any) or the display of the primary root window. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.AnimationSmoothness.DeskEndGesture
histogram.summary: When a four finger touchpad swipe has ended, an animation to the nearest desk will occur. This histogram is emitted when that animation finishes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.AnimationSmoothness.DeskRemoval
histogram.summary: Emitted when the virtual desks removal animation completes to report the smoothness of this animation when running on the display on which the active window resides (if any) or the display of the primary root window. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.BentoBarEnabled
histogram.summary: Emits true if a user clicked `Show deskbar` inside the context menu of bento bar or desks bar in overview mode, false if `Hide deskbar` inside the same context menu being clicked.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.BentoBarIsVisible
histogram.summary: Emits true when the bento bar is created for the user. Will not emit false if the bento bar has never been created for the user. This will be used to count the number of users who saw the bento bar.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.ConsecutiveDailyVisits
histogram.summary: Emitted when a desk is destroyed or a user activates a desk they haven't visited the prior day. In the former case, reports the number of consecutive days a user visited the newly-closed desk. In the latter case, reports the number of consecutive days a user visited the desk during the previous visit. This metric is persisted across multiple sessions and restarts. I.e. if a user logs out and logs back in their desk's consecutive daily visits will be restored. This metric uses the user's local timezone so if they move back in time via timezone change, this metric will be reset.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.DeskLifetime_{DeskIndex}
histogram.summary: The lifetime of the desk at index {DeskIndex} (1-indexed). Emitted when a desk is removed. This metric is persisted across multiple sessions and restarts. I.e. if a user logs out and logs back in their desk's lifetime will be restored.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.DesksCount2
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2021. #enhanced-desks flag is removed from chrome://flags, which means users will not able to switch to classic desks. Make this histogram only for classic desks obsolete.
histogram.summary: Emitted when there's a change in the virtual desks count whether due to desk creation or removal in classic desks. Specifies the number of available desks. It is not emitted for the first-ever created default desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.DesksCount3
histogram.summary: Emitted when there's a change in the virtual desks count whether due to desk creation or removal in Bento. Specifies the number of available desks. It is not emitted for the first-ever created default desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.DesksSwitch
histogram.summary: Emitted when the active desk is changed to specify the source of this action, i.e. whether due to new-desk shortcut, desk removed, window activated, switch-desk shortcut, or a press on the desk mini_view.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.MoveWindowFromActiveDesk
histogram.summary: Emitted when a window is moved from the current active desk to another desk. Specifies the source of this action, i.e. whether to window drag-and-drop, or keyboard shortcut. As of M90, the "Assign to desk menu" bucket is emitted when a user assigns a window to all desks through its context menu. Prior to this, the "Assign to desk menu" bucket was emitted when a user switched desks and their All Desks windows were moved from the old active desk to the new active desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NewDesk2
histogram.summary: Emitted when a virtual desk is created to specify the source of this action, i.e. whether from the new-desk button, keyboard shortcut, or due to desks restore. It is not emitted for the first-ever created default desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfDeskTraversals
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a desk (virtual workspace) has visibly changed in a time span of five seconds. This counts the number of total traversals; for example if the user has moved from desk 1 to 2 to 1 to 2 to 3, the number recorded is 4. This only gets recorded if a traversal starts. A traversal means that the desk has changed onscreen.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_1
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the first desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_2
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the second desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_3
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the third desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_4
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the fourth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_5
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the fifth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_6
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the sixth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_7
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the seventh desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NumberOfWindowsOnDesk_8
histogram.summary: The number of windows on the eighth desk. Emitted when a desk is removed, or a window is moved to another desk.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.PresentationTime.UpdateGesture
histogram.summary: Presentation time in ms when a four finger swipe is being used to change desks. One full swipe results in multiple emissions of this metric; once everytime the fingers change location on the trackpad. Presentation time is the time it takes from when the software recognizes the touchpad swipe to when the next frame is displayed on the screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.PresentationTime.UpdateGesture.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: The largest presentation time value in ms for a single four finger swipe to change desks. One full swipe results in one emission of this metric; its the largest value of Ash.Desks.PresentationTime.UpdateGesture which is emitted multiple times during a single full swipe. Presentation time is the time it takes from when the software recognizes the touchpad swipe to when the next frame is displayed on the frame.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.RemoveDesk
histogram.summary: Emitted when a virtual desk is removed to specify the source of this remove operation, i.e. whether from the close-desk button, or keyboard shortcut.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.UserHasUsedDesksRecently
histogram.summary: Emitted true when first session started and detected user pref `kUserHasUsedDesksRecently` has been set to true for the user. Will not emit false otherwise. This will be used to count the number of users that `kUserHasUsedDesksRecently` has been set to true.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.WeeklyActiveDesks
histogram.summary: The number of unique weekly active desks a user has interacted with in a week. A desk is considered interacted with if a window is moved to it, it is created, its name is changed, or it is activated and stayed on for at least 3s. This metric is persisted across multiple sessions and restarts. I.e. if a user logs out and logs back in. This metric is reported a week after it begins counting. If a session is restored and more than a week has elapsed since counting has begun, the restored data will be emitted as an entry and this metric will be reset.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.LaunchFromTemplate
histogram.summary: Emitted when a template is launched and a desk is created.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.TabCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of tabs in a template when it is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.UserTemplateCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of templates a user has saved when a template is saved or deleted.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.WindowAndTabCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of windows and tabs in a template when it is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.DeskTemplate.WindowCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of windows in a template when it is saved.

histogram.name: Ash.Desktop.TimeBetweenNavigateToTaskSwitches
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between task window activations triggered by users clicking or tapping on a window, as recorded by the Desktop_SwitchTask user action. Recorded on Chrome OS only. Task switches from other sources are ignored and do not affect this metric. In other words, if a user performs the following steps (1) click on task window 'A' (2) Alt+Tab to task 'Z'(3) click on task window 'B', then this will result in a sample recorded for the time delta between activating task window 'A'and 'B'.

histogram.name: Ash.Display.InternalDisplay.ActiveEffectiveResolution
histogram.summary: The effective resolution of the internal display after device scale factor and display zoom level has been applied. This is the exact value matching the display's effective resolution. This is emitted at regular intervals.

histogram.name: Ash.Display.PrimaryDisplayZoomAtStartup
histogram.summary: The display zoom setting for the primary display, recorded on startup.

histogram.name: Ash.DisplayChangeDialog.Saved
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user chooses an option on the Display Change Dialog that is shown when a user changes the resolution of an external display.

histogram.name: Ash.DisplayColorManager.HasColorCorrectionMatrix
histogram.summary: Whether a display has a "CTM" matrix properties that can be used to set a color transform matrix. Recorded every time there is a display configuration update.

histogram.name: Ash.DisplayColorManager.IccFileDownloaded
histogram.summary: This boolean keeps track if an ICC file was downloaded correctly (if true) or a local file was reused instead.

histogram.name: Ash.DisplayColorManager.ValidDisplayColorSpace
histogram.summary: This boolean keeps track if a Display update (i.e. when connecting a new one) carried valid ColorSpace information.

histogram.name: Ash.DisplayColorManager.ValidProductId
histogram.summary: Whether we could parse a valid product id from a display EDID. Recorded every time there is a display configuration update.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.Action
histogram.summary: User-initiated action taken that affects docked windows such as docking, undocking, minimizing, restoring, closing or just dragging a docked window.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ActionSource
histogram.summary: Source (mouse, touch, keyboard or unknown) of the user-initiated action for docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsAll
histogram.summary: Number of all docked windows or panels including hidden or minimized. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsLarge
histogram.summary: Number of large (wider than dock maximum width) windows that had to be shrunk to get docked among the visible docked windows. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsPanels
histogram.summary: Number of docked visible panels. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.ItemsVisible
histogram.summary: Number of visible docked windows or panels. Recorded on every user action that interacts with docked windows.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.TimeBetweenUse
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between instances of docking, undocking or any other action affecting docked state of a window.

histogram.name: Ash.Dock.Width
histogram.summary: Width of the docked area in pixels. Recorded every time it changes after a user window resize operation is completed.

histogram.name: Ash.DragWindowFromShelf.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time in ms when a window is dragged from the bottom of the shelf. Recorded when the drag action is in progress.

histogram.name: Ash.DragWindowFromShelf.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time in ms when a window is dragged from the bottom of the shelf. Recorded when the drag action is finished.

histogram.name: Ash.Homescreen.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when performing tablet mode homescreen animations, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.HotseatGesture
histogram.summary: Gestures supported by the in-app hotseat.

histogram.name: Ash.HotseatTransition.AnimationSmoothness{HotseatTransitionType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the animation smoothness for the ShelfWidget's animating background during transitions of the hotseat to shown, extended, and hidden hotseat states. Check Ash.HotseatWidgetAnimation.AnimationSmoothness for smoothness of the HotseatWidget. {HotseatTransitionType}

variant.obsolete: Base histogram. Use suffixes of this histogram instead.

histogram.name: Ash.HotseatTransition.Drag.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time in ms of the hotseat when it changes between the hidden and the extended state as a result of a drag action. Recorded when the drag action is in progress.

histogram.name: Ash.HotseatTransition.Drag.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time in ms of the hotseat when it changes between the hidden and the extended state as a result of a drag action. Recorded when the drag action is finished.

histogram.name: Ash.HotseatWidgetAnimation.AnimationSmoothness{HotseatTransitionType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the animation smoothness for the bounds animation of the hotseat widget's elements during transitions of the hotseat to shown, extended, and hidden hotseat states. Check Ash.HotseatTransition.AnimationSmoothness for smoothness of the shelf's animating background. {HotseatTransitionType}

histogram.name: Ash.HotseatWidgetAnimation.{HotseatWidgetElement}AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Tracks the animation smoothness for the bounds animation of the hotseat widget's elements during transitions of the hotseat to shown, extended, and hidden hotseat states. Check Ash.HotseatTransition.AnimationSmoothness for smoothness of the shelf's animating background. {HotseatWidgetElement}

variant.obsolete: Base histogram. Use suffixes of this histogram instead.

histogram.name: Ash.ImmersiveFullscreen.WindowType
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2020 in Issue 1138662 - its recording code was deleted. This histogram entry was added long time ago, likely when immersive fullscreen was first added (circa 2014), and there is no records of what was learned.
histogram.summary: The type of the window which is put into immersive fullscreen. Immersive fullscreen is entered via the F4 key.

histogram.name: Ash.InteractiveWindowResize.TimeToPresent
histogram.summary: Time between when the size of a window changes during an interactive window resize and the results are drawn (presented) on screen. This is recorded for each movement of the mouse/pointer that results in a resize.

histogram.name: Ash.InteractiveWindowResize.TimeToPresent.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum time between when the size of a window changes during an interactive window resize and the results are drawn (presented) on screen. This is recorded for each movement of the mouse/pointer that results in a resize.

histogram.name: Ash.Lacros.Launch.Mode
histogram.summary: The Lacros operation mode. This will record if Ash is the only browser, both browsers are running side by side or if Lacros is the only browser. It will be emitted once when the system (Ash) starts.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.AuthMethod.Switched
histogram.summary: The count of auth method switching actions on ChromeOS lock screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.AuthMethod.Used.ClamShellMode
histogram.summary: The usage of different auth methods (PIN / Password / Smartlock / Fingerprint / Challenge response) on Chromebooks in clamshell mode and on other form-factors.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.AuthMethod.Used.TabletMode
histogram.summary: The usage of different auth methods (PIN / Password / Smartlock / Fingerprint / Challenge response) on Chromebooks in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.NbPasswordAttempts.UntilFailure
histogram.summary: The number of incorrect passwords entered in Chrome OS login/lock screen until the user gives up (user signs out the current session or shuts down the device).

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.NbPasswordAttempts.UntilSuccess
histogram.summary: The number of incorrect passwords entered in Chrome OS login/lock screen until a successful attempt.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.UserClicks
histogram.summary: The numbers of times that users click on the shelf buttons, trays and lock screen note on the ChromeOS lock screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.AuthMethod.Switched
histogram.summary: The count of auth method switching actions on ChromeOS login screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.AuthMethod.Used.ClamShellMode
histogram.summary: The usage of different auth methods (PIN / Password / Smartlock / Fingerprint / Challenge response) on Chromebooks in clamshell mode and on other form-factors.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.AuthMethod.Used.TabletMode
histogram.summary: The usage of different auth methods (PIN / Password / Smartlock / Fingerprint / Challenge response) on Chromebooks in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.MigrationBanner
histogram.summary: Whether the cryptohome migration banner was shown on the Chrome OS login screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Login.UserClicks
histogram.summary: The numbers of times that users click on the shelf buttons and trays on the ChromeOS login screen.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.OOBE.UserClicks
histogram.summary: What shelf buttons or trays are clicked in the OOBE.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.PinAutosubmit.Backfill
histogram.summary: The result of the PIN auto submit 'Backfill' operation. Users updating to M86 with an existing PIN will have their preference regarding auto submit 'backfilled' to either enabled or disabled.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginAnimation.Duration
histogram.summary: The duration of how long it took to finish all animations applied during the login process, from the time the first animation is added, to the time the last animation is finished.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginAnimation.Jank
histogram.summary: Jank metrics of all animations applied during the login process. This represents how often the frame update rate changed during animation.

histogram.name: Ash.LoginAnimation.Smoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of all animations applied during the login process. 100% represents the ideal smoothness for 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.Media.CameraPrivacySwitch.Event
histogram.summary: Reports events related to camera privacy switch state. The camera privacy switch is a hardware toggle supported by some Chrome OS devices that disables the built in camera video feed. The histogram is reported (1) when a camera privacy switch state change is detected (which generally causes a system toast to get shown), and (2) when a notification informing the user that the camera privacy switch is on (the notification is shown if the user tries to use their camera with the privacy switch tuned on). The camera privacy switch state is only recorded if the state change is a result of a user action - it will not be recorded for state changes that are a result of camera privacy switch state initialization.

histogram.name: Ash.Media.CameraPrivacySwitch.TimeFromNotificationToOff
histogram.summary: Time from showing a notification informing the user about the camera privacy switch to the user turning the privacy switch off. The camera privacy switch is a hardware switch supported by some Chrome OS devices that cuts the video camera feed off. The Chrome OS UI shows a notification if the user tries to use the camera with the privacy switch on. The intention is to track the time it takes for the user to flip the privacy switch after they're notified the camera is disabled. The histogram is recorded if the user toggles the camera privacy switch after seeing the notification about the privacy switch being on (if the switch is toggled more than once after the notification gets shown, only the first toggle action will be reported). The time is reported in seconds with 5 second granularity.

histogram.name: Ash.MessageCenter.Scroll.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time while scrolling through the list of notifications in Notification Center. Emitted when Notification Center is scrolled.

histogram.name: Ash.MessageCenter.Scroll.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Presentation time while scrolling through the list of notifications in Notification Center. Emitted when Notification Center is scrolled.

histogram.name: Ash.NavigationWidget.AnimationSmoothness{HotseatTransitionType}
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of the navigation widget's elements, which are the widget itself and its child views. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. Recorded every time an animation is triggered in the Navigation Widget. We record this metric for each element separately. {HotseatTransitionType}

histogram.name: Ash.NavigationWidget.{NavigationWidgetElement}AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of the navigation widget's elements, which are the widget itself and its child views. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. Recorded every time an animation is triggered in the Navigation Widget. We record this metric for each element separately. {NavigationWidgetElement}

variant.obsolete: Base histogram. Use suffixes of this histogram instead.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.AutoNightLightNotificationShown
histogram.summary: Emitted when the Auto Night Light notification is shown.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.AutoNightLightNotificationState
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user interacts with the Auto Night Light notification to report the state of the notification as a result of this interaction.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.DisplayCrtcCtmSupport
histogram.summary: The type of CRTC color transorm matrix support for the currently connected displays. Emitted when cursor compositing status is refreshed, but only when Night Light is on. The cursor compositing status is refreshed whenever there is a change in Night Light status or color temperature.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.ScheduleType
histogram.summary: The selected Night Light schedule type. Emitted when the user changes the Night Light schedule type from the Display System Settings.

histogram.name: Ash.NightLight.Temperature
histogram.summary: The ranges in which the selected values of the Night Light color temperature reside. Emitted when the user drags the Night Light color temperature slider to change its value from the Display System Settings.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.ClearAllStacked.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the "clear all" animation in the CrOS message center. This occurs when the clear all button is pressed with notifications that are not visible on screen. Measured via a throughtput tracker.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.ClearAllVisible.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the "clear all" animation in the CrOS message center. This occurs when the clear all button is pressed and all notifications are visible. Measured via a throughtput tracker.

histogram.name: Ash.Notification.MoveDown.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Animation smoothness of the "move down" animation in the CrOS message center. This occurs when a notification is removed and notifications above the deleted one animate downwards to fill in the space. Measured via a throughtput tracker.

histogram.name: Ash.NotificationPopup.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of notification pop-up. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Emitted when pop-up animations are completed, including pop-up fade-in, fade-out, move-up, move-down.

histogram.name: Ash.NumberOfVisibleWindowsInPrimaryDisplay
histogram.summary: An upper bound on the number of windows visible to the user on the primary display. Determined by processing the windows in increasing z-order and counting all non-minimized windows until a maximized or fullscreen window is processed. This metric is logged periodically every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.AnimationSmoothness.Close
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when closing a window, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.AnimationSmoothness.Enter{OverviewAnimationMode}

variant.obsolete: Base histogram. Use suffixes of this histogram instead.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.AnimationSmoothness.Exit{OverviewAnimationMode}

variant.obsolete: Base histogram. Use suffixes of this histogram instead.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.ArrowKeyPresses
histogram.summary: The number of times the arrow keys are pressed in overview mode per session, i.e. between bringing up overview mode and ending it. This is only measured for the sessions that end by selecting a window with the enter key.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.EndAction
histogram.summary: Emitted when exiting overview mode. Recording the reasons for ending overview mode. E.g, pressing the overview button at status area.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Items
histogram.summary: The number of items (single windows or groups of windows such as panels) in the overview mode, present at the start of each session.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.KeyPressesOverItemsRatio
histogram.summary: The ratio between the arrow key presses and the number of overview items, expressed as a percentage for a single session. Recorded when an overview session is exited after selecting a highlighted overview item.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.OverviewClosedItems
histogram.summary: The number of items closed from the window overview for a single session. Recorded when exiting an overview session.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Scroll.PresentationTime.MaxLatency.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time for scrolling the overview grid in overview mode for a scrolling session.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.Scroll.PresentationTime.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Presentation time for scrolling the overview grid in overview mode. Each time the grid is updated by a scroll, the time it takes to update the new visuals onto the screen is updated.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.SelectionDepth
histogram.summary: When a window is selected in overview mode, records that window's position in the global MRU ordering. 1 represents the most-recently used window, 2 represents the next most-recently used window, and so on.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.StartAction
histogram.summary: Emitted when entering overview mode. Recording the reasons for starting overview mode. E.g, pressing the overview button at status area.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.TimeBetweenActiveWindowChanges
histogram.summary: The amount of time between endings of overview mode sessions which were caused by the user selecting a window which was not previously active. Only recorded on the second and later times after startup that the user selected a window which was not previously active.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.TimeBetweenUse
histogram.summary: The amount of time between uses of overview mode, recorded when overview mode is entered. Only recorded on the second and later times after startup that the user entered overview mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.TimeInOverview
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in overview mode. Overview mode is engaged by pressing the overview accelerator, overview button tray or swiping up from the shelf in tablet mode. The time is measured from the moment the windows begin animating to a thumbnail size preview to when a window is selected or selection is canceled. Recorded when an overview session is exited, before the exit animation starts.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.WindowDrag.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time for dragging a window in overview mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.WindowDrag.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time for dragging a window in overview mode.

histogram.name: Ash.Overview.WindowDrag.Workflow
histogram.summary: Recorded when a drag from overview (not from the top or shelf) is completed, and when an overview item is closed by vertically swiping or flinging (even if you fling without dragging).

histogram.name: Ash.PciePeripheral.ConnectivityResults
histogram.summary: The connectivity results of when the user plugs in a Thunderbolt/USB4 peripheral to their Chrome OS device. This is recorded for only devices that support Thunderbolt/USB4 connectivity. Gets recorded every time a Thunderbolt/USB4 peripheral is plugged in.

histogram.name: Ash.PersistentWindow.NumOfWindowsRestored
histogram.obsolete: Expired on M82. Marked as obsolete on 10/2021. Replaced by Ash.PersistentWindow.NumOfWindowsRestoredOnDisplayAdded.
histogram.summary: The number of windows restored in multi-display scenario, such as due to disconnecting and reconnecting display, enabling and disabling mirror mode, entering and leaving dock mode. Zero is not recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.PersistentWindow.NumOfWindowsRestoredOnDisplayAdded
histogram.summary: The number of windows restored in multi-display scenario, such as due to disconnecting and reconnecting display, enabling and disabling mirror mode, entering and leaving dock mode. Zero is not recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.PersistentWindow.NumOfWindowsRestoredOnScreenRotation
histogram.summary: Emits the number of windows bounds restored when rotating the screen back to the previous screen orientation. Zero is not recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.PhoneHub.InterstitialScreenEvent.{Screen}
histogram.summary: Events logged when the given PhoneHub interstitial screen is shown.

histogram.name: Ash.PhoneHub.NotificationCount
histogram.summary: The number of PhoneHub notifications, logged each time a notification is added or removed.

histogram.name: Ash.PhoneHub.NotificationOptInEvents
histogram.summary: Events for the given notification opt-in prompt.

histogram.name: Ash.PhoneHub.QuickActionClicked
histogram.summary: Event logged after the user clicks on a quick action.

histogram.name: Ash.PhoneHub.ScreenOnSettingsButtonClicked
histogram.summary: Logs the current screen when the settings button is clicked in the tray bubble.

histogram.name: Ash.PhoneHub.ScreenOn{BubbleEvent}
histogram.summary: Logs the current screen for the PhoneHub tray given bubble event (i.e. on bubble open or close).

histogram.name: Ash.PhoneHub.TabContinuationChipClicked
histogram.summary: After a tab continuation chip is clicked, the index of the tab is logged. Tab indices are ordered left-to-right, top-to-bottom in a standard LTR locale.

histogram.name: Ash.Pip.AndroidPipUseTime
histogram.summary: How long Android PIP was used for, upon ending the session.

histogram.name: Ash.Pip.Events
histogram.summary: Various individiual Picture-in-picture related events. See AshPipEvents.

histogram.name: Ash.Pip.FreeResizeFinishArea
histogram.summary: Area of a Picture-in-picture window when ending a free-resize, as a percentage of the area it takes up on the display it is on.

histogram.name: Ash.Pip.FreeResizeInitialArea
histogram.summary: Initial area of a Picture-in-picture window when beginning a free-resize, as a percentage of the area it takes up on the display it is on.

histogram.name: Ash.Pip.Position
histogram.summary: The position that a Picture-in-picture window was moved to by a user drag.

histogram.name: Ash.PowerButtonScreenshot.DelayBetweenAccelKeyPressed
histogram.summary: Record the delay when power button and volume down key are both pressed, which indicates user might want to use accelerator to take screenshot. This will help us determine the best chord delay among metrics.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.MarkerColor.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the user chooses a marker color on the Projector toolbar in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.Projector.Toolbar.{TabletOrClamshell}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the user opens, closes, or presses a button the Projector toolbar in {TabletOrClamshell}.

histogram.name: Ash.Rotation.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when rotating screen. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when the user rotates the screen.

histogram.name: Ash.ScreenshotController.ScreenshotsPerDay
histogram.summary: Records the number of screenshots that have been taken via the ScreenshotController every 24 hours. Note that counts are not persisted across crashes, restarts, or sessions so this is only intended to give a rough approximation.

histogram.name: Ash.ScreenshotController.ScreenshotsPerWeek
histogram.summary: Records the number of screenshots that have been taken via the ScreenshotController every 7 days. Note that counts are not persisted across crashes, restarts, or sessions so this is only intended to give a rough approximation. This means that this metric will only be recorded in sessions spanning at least 7 days.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Menu.NumItemsEnabledUponSelection
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of menu items that are enabled in a shelf item's secondary menu. This metric is only recorded when a menu item is selected.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Menu.SelectedMenuItemIndex
histogram.summary: Tracks the index of the selected menu item in a shelf item's secondary menu. This metric is only recorded when a menu item is selected.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NavigationButtonsInTabletMode.ReasonShown
histogram.summary: The reason shelf navigation buttons are shown in tablet mode. The buttons are shown when the device is in tablet mode only if certain accessibility settings are enabled. This histogram records which accessibility setting caused the buttons to be shown. Shown when navigation buttons visibility changes in tablet mode, and only if HideShelfControlsInTabletMode feature is enabled.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfItems
histogram.summary: The number of icons in the shelf, not including the App Launcher icon. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfPinnedItems
histogram.summary: The number of pinned icons in the shelf, not including the App Launcher icon. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.NumberOfUnpinnedItems
histogram.summary: The number of unpinned icons in the shelf. This metric is recorded every 30 minutes.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.CircledPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of the screen area circled by the Assistant pen. Recorded when the "closed shape" gesture is recognized.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GestureDuration
histogram.summary: The duration of an Assistant pen gesture. Recorded at the end of every gesture.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GestureInterval
histogram.summary: The interval between subsequent Assistant pen gestures within a session. Session is defined as the period while the Assistant tool is enabled. Recorded at the end of each gesture except for the first one in the session. The interval is computed excluding the gesture duration.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GesturesPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of Assistant pen gestures per session. Session is defined as the period while the Assistant tool is enabled. Recorded at the end of the session.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GesturesPerSession.Recognized
histogram.summary: The number of recognized Assistant pen gestures per session. Session is defined as the period while the Assistant tool is enabled. Recorded at the end of the session.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.GestureType
histogram.summary: The type of the Assistant pen gesture. Recorded at the end of each gesture.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Assistant.HighlighterLength
histogram.summary: The length of a recognized "horizontal stroke" Assistant pen gesture. Recorded at the and of the gesture.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.InAssistantMode
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in Palette Assistant mode. Recorded when the Assistant mode is exited.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.InLaserPointerMode
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend in Palette Laser pointer mode. Recorded when the Laser pointer mode is exited.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.InMagnifyMode
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend in Palette Magnify mode. Recorded when the Magnify mode is exited.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.ModeCancellation
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times a palette mode is explicitly cancelled or switched out of.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Usage
histogram.summary: Recorded every time that the palette option has been selected from the palette that has been opened manually (not via a stylus eject event).

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Usage.AutoOpened
histogram.summary: Recorded every time that the palette option has been selected from the palette that has been opened automatically (by a stylus eject event).

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.Palette.Usage.Shortcut
histogram.summary: Recorded every time that the palette option has been selected by means other that the palette menu (e.g. stylus barrel button or a keyboard accelerator).

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.TimeBetweenNavigateToTaskSwitches
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between contiguous task switch user actions triggered by the Shelf buttons where the user activates a different user-predictable task. Task switches from other sources are ignored and do not affect this metric. In other words, if a user performs the following steps (1) launch task 'A' from the Shelf (2) Alt+Tab to task 'Z' (3) launch task 'B' from the Shelf, then this will result in a sample recorded for the time delta between launching tasks 'A' and 'B'.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.TimeBetweenWindowMinimizedAndActivatedActions
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time between a window being minimized by the shelf and subsequently activated. In other words this metric is only recorded if a shelf button pressed action causes a window to be minimized and the very next shelf button pressed action causes the same window to be activated.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.UkmLogger.HasNightLightSchedule
histogram.summary: Whether or not the user had set up a night light schedule at the time of night light event logging.

histogram.name: Ash.Shelf.UkmLogger.NumAvailableBluetoothDevices
histogram.summary: The number of Bluetooth devices available at the time of Bluetooth event logging.

histogram.name: Ash.ShelfAlignmentOverTime
histogram.summary: The current state of the shelf (alignment) tracked over time by logging on a regular basis (30 minutes), this is used instead of log in or shelf usage to track users that do not lock/unlock or log in frequently and use a small number of browser instances or otherwise infrequently interact with the shelf launcher.

histogram.name: Ash.ShelfAlignmentUsage
histogram.summary: The current state of the shelf (alignment) when the shelf launcher is used to launch an app/window/etc, this is used instead of log in to give data on users that do not lock/unlock or log in frequently.

histogram.name: Ash.ShelfIcon.AnimationSmoothness{ShelfIconAnimationType}
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of the shelf icons. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. Recorded when shelf icon animations are completed, including icon move, icon fade-in and icon fade-out. {ShelfIconAnimationType}

histogram.name: Ash.Smoothness.MaxPercentDroppedFrames_1sWindow
histogram.summary:
Similar to "Graphics.Smoothness.MaxPercentDroppedFrames_1sWindow" but for ui::Compositor. Tracks the max percent of dropped frames for in a 1 second sliding window.
PercentDroppedFrames is measured by tracking the number of frames which were not displayed on screen out of the total number of frames expected to be produced and displayed. In other words, the lower this number is, the smoother experience.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.DeviceOrientation.{DeviceUIMode}
histogram.summary: Emitted at entry to split view mode and each time the orientation or the device mode changes to report whether the device is in clamshell mode or tablet mode and whether the orientation is landscape or portrait.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.EntryPoint.DeviceOrientation
histogram.summary: Emitted at the entry point of split view mode, to report the device orientation is in landscape mode (left and right) or portrait mode (top and bottom).

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.EntryPoint.DeviceUIMode
histogram.summary: Emitted at the entry point of split view mode, to report the device is in clamshell mode or tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.OrientationInSplitView
histogram.summary: Emitted when device orientation changes in split view, to report the device orientation is in landscape mode (left and right) or portrait mode (top and bottom).

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.ResizeWindowCount.{DeviceUIMode}
histogram.summary: Emitted at the end of split view mode to report the number of resizing window operations in split view mode session for both clamshell and tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.SwapWindowCount
histogram.summary: Emitted at the end of split view mode to report the number of swap window operations in split view mode session.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.TimeInMultiDisplaySplitView
histogram.summary: The amount of time that the user spent in multi-display split view mode, meaning that split view is active on more than one display. The time is measured from when the number of displays in split view becomes more than one to when it drops back down to one.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.TimeInSplitView
histogram.summary: The amount of time that the user spent in split view mode. The time is measured from the moment a window is snapped to one side of the screen to when split view mode is ended.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitView.{EngagementTime}.{DeviceUIMode}
histogram.summary: Emitted at the end of split view mode or the point of switching between clamshell mode and tablet mode in split view, to report the engagement time of general split view and multi-display split view in both clamshell mode and tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewResize.AnimationSmoothness.DividerAnimation
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animation when releasing the split view divider, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewResize.PresentationTime.MaxLatency{SplitViewResizeModes}
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation time while resizing one or two split view windows. {SplitViewResizeModes}

variant.obsolete: Base histogram. Use suffixes of this histogram instead.

histogram.name: Ash.SplitViewResize.PresentationTime{SplitViewResizeModes}
histogram.summary: Presentation time while resizing one or two split view windows. {SplitViewResizeModes}

variant.obsolete: Base histogram. Use suffixes of this histogram instead.

histogram.name: Ash.StatusAreaShowBubble.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time while opening QuickSettings and Notification Center through Status Area button. Emitted when QuickSettings and Notification Center are opened and shown.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeDownDrag.Tab.PresentationTime.MaxLatency.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation timestamp while dragging a tab in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeDownDrag.Tab.PresentationTime.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Presentation time while dragging a tab in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeDownDrag.Window.PresentationTime.MaxLatency.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Maximum latency of the presentation timestamp while dragging maximized window in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeDownDrag.Window.PresentationTime.TabletMode
histogram.summary: Presentation time while dragging maximized window in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.SwipeHomeToOverviewGesture
histogram.summary: Boolean indicating whether a swipe from hotseat on home screen resulted in a transition to overview.

histogram.name: Ash.SystemMenu.DefaultView.VisibleRows
histogram.summary: The visible rows displayed in the system menu's default view. Recorded each time the menu is opened.

histogram.name: Ash.SystemMenu.PercentageOfWorkAreaHeightCoveredByMenu
histogram.summary: The height of the system menu divided by the height of the Ash desktop work area; a value over 100% indicates that a portion of the system menu is not visible to the user. Recorded each time the menu is opened.

histogram.name: Ash.SystemMenu.Rows
histogram.summary: The number of user-visible rows in the system menu's default view. Recorded each time the menu is opened.

histogram.name: Ash.TabDrag.PresentationTime
histogram.summary: Presentation time in ms when a tab is dragged. In clamshell mode, each time a tab is dragged within a display, the time it takes to present the new frame on screen is recorded. In tablet mode (with webui tab strip enable), dragging between displays is precluded, thus each time a tab is dragged, the time it takes to present the new frame to screen is recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.TabDrag.PresentationTime.MaxLatency
histogram.summary: Maximum presentation time recorded during a tab dragging session in both clamshell and tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.TabletMode.AnimationSmoothness.Enter
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when entering tablet mode, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.TabletMode.AnimationSmoothness.Exit
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when exiting tablet mode, recorded when the animation completes. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between contiguous task switch user actions triggered by any of the other task switch actions that are tracked. (e.g., Ash.Shelf.TimeBetweenNavigateToTaskSwitches, Ash.Tab.TimeBetweenSwitchToExistingTabUserActions, Ash.WindowCycleController.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches, Ash.AppList.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches, Ash.Overview.TimeBetweenActiveWindowChanges, etc). Note the Ash.AppList.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches and Ash.Tab.TimeBetweenSwitchToExistingTabUserActions histograms were deprecated and removed in 10/2016. Note that Ash.Overview.TimeBetweenActiveWindowChanges was renamed from Ash.WindowSelector.TimeBetweenActiveWindowChanges on 04/2021.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchMoveSteps
histogram.summary: The distance between touch-move events.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchStartAfterEnd
histogram.summary: The interval between the end of a touch-sequence and the start of the next touch-sequence.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.LidAngle
histogram.summary: Chrome OS only. The computed angle between the lid and the keyboard panel. These values are imprecise and may be tens of degrees off from reality. Reported once per hour that the system is awake, and not reported if the system doesn't have two accelerometers.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActive
histogram.summary: The length of time that TouchView is active, for each activation.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActivePercentage
histogram.summary: The proportion of time spent in TouchView during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewActiveTotal
histogram.summary: The total time that TouchView is active during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewInactive
histogram.summary: The length of time between TouchView activations.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchView.TouchViewInactiveTotal
histogram.summary: The total time that TouchView is not active during a session.

histogram.name: Ash.UnlockAnimation.Duration
histogram.summary: The duration of how long it took to finish all animations applied during the login process, from the time the first animation is added, to the time the last animation is finished.

histogram.name: Ash.UnlockAnimation.Jank
histogram.summary: Jank metrics of all animations applied during the unlock process. This represents how often the frame update rate changed during animation.

histogram.name: Ash.UnlockAnimation.Smoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of all animations applied during the unlock process. 100% represents the ideal smoothness for 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.UserDataStatsRecorder.DataSize.TotalSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the entire profile data directory. Collected upon launching ash chrome.

histogram.name: Ash.UserDataStatsRecorder.DataSize.{ItemName}
histogram.summary: Records the size of each file/dir directly under user data directory.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Collection
histogram.summary: The wallpaper collection of the selected online wallpaper. Recorded each time the online wallpaper image is selected, but not when wallpaper is automatically refreshed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.ColorExtractionResult2
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate for wallpaper color extraction. Recorded each time the wallpaper image changes for each extracted wallpaper prominent color.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.CustomLayout
histogram.summary: The custom wallpaper layout type. Recorded when the user sets a new custom wallpaper or changes the existing custom wallpaper's layout.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Image
histogram.summary: The selected online wallpaper. Recorded each time the online wallpaper image is selected, but not when wallpaper is automatically refreshed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Preview.Show
histogram.summary: Tracks the preview mode usage for wallpaper. Recorded each time the wallpaper image is previewed.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Source
histogram.summary: Recorded when a new wallpaper is set, either by the built-in Wallpaper Picker App, or by a third party App. Note the wallpaper change triggered by Sync file system event doesn't count.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Type
histogram.summary: The wallpaper type. Recorded at user login.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.CrossFade
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of cross fade animation when setting window bounds. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when SetBoundsDirectCrossFade is called, such as when window is maximized.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.CrossFade.DragMaximize
histogram.summary: When dragging a maximized window, the window will shrink to restore bounds. Dragging the window back to the top of the screen will expand the window. This histogram will be recorded to measure the smoothenss of the expand animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.CrossFade.DragUnmaximize
histogram.summary: When dragging a maximized window, the window will shrink to restore bounds. This histogram will be recorded to measure the smoothness of the shrink animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.Hide
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of hiding window animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when AnimateHideWindowCommon is called, such as when window is closed.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.AnimationSmoothness.Snap
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of snapping window animation. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when a window is snapped to the left or right in clamshell mode using the alt + [ or ] accelerator, but only if the size of the window's bounds change.

histogram.name: Ash.Window.Snap.DeviceOrientation
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user snaps the window to record whether window snap is used while the display orientation is portrait or landscape mode.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.DesksSwitchDistance
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user ends window cycling via Alt-Tab, if and only if user had 2 or more desks and a new window was activated, to report the distance between the active desks before and after window cycling. A distance of 0 means no desks switch occurred.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.InitialMode
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user starts Alt-Tab, if and only if user had 2 or more desks and Bento is not disabled, to report the initial alt-tab mode, which signals user's saved and preferred mode.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.Items
histogram.summary: The number of windows in the Alt+Tab selector. Only recorded once when cycling starts, not every time when Tab is pressed without releasing Alt.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.ModeSwitchSource
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user switches the Alt-Tab mode, if and only if user had 2 or more desks and Bento is not disabled, to report whether the user switches the mode via a click or keyboard.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.SwitchMode
histogram.summary: Emitted when the user switches the Alt-Tab mode from a click or keyboard, if and only if user had 2 or more desks and Bento is not disabled, to report the alt-tab mode the user switches to.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between task switches triggered by the next window and previous window accelerator keys (ie Alt+Tab, Alt+Shift+Tab).

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleView.AnimationSmoothness.Container
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of showing window animation when the window cycle view moves the next window into position when alt + tab is pressed. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleView.AnimationSmoothness.Show
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of showing window animation when the window cycle view starts. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowDragFromShelfResult
histogram.summary: The final state after window drag gesture that started from the system shelf in tablet mode.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowManager.Lock.Success
histogram.summary: How long it took for the screen lock process to complete. This does not include timeouts.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowManager.Lock.Timeout
histogram.summary: How long it took for the screen lock process to complete, for timeouts only.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.ArrowKeyPresses
histogram.summary: The number of times the arrow keys are pressed in overview mode per session, i.e. between bringing up overview mode and ending it. This is only measured for the sessions that end by selecting a window with the enter key.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.Items
histogram.summary: The number of items (single windows or groups of windows such as panels) in the overview mode, present at the start of each session.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.ItemsWhenTextFilteringUsed
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2021 as of https://crrev.com/c/2816339. The text filtering feature has been removed.
histogram.summary: The number of items showing in overview mode at the moment when an item is selected or when selection is canceled. Only recorded if the text filtering textfield contains a non-empty string.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.KeyPressesOverItemsRatio
histogram.summary: The ratio between the arrow key presses and the number of overview items, expressed as a percentage for a single session.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.OverviewClosedItems
histogram.summary: The number of items closed from the window overview for a single session.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.SelectionDepth
histogram.summary: When a window is selected in overview mode, records that window's position in the global MRU ordering. 1 represents the most-recently used window, 2 represents the next most-recently used window, and so on.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TextFilteringStringLength
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2021 as of https://crrev.com/c/2816339. The text filtering feature has been removed.
histogram.summary: The length of the string entered into the text filtering textfield at the moment when an item is selected or when selection is canceled.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TextFilteringTextfieldCleared
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2021 as of https://crrev.com/c/2816339. The text filtering feature has been removed.
histogram.summary: The number of times the text filtering textfield has had all of its text removed within a single overview mode session. Measured from the time overview mode is invoked to when an item is selected or when selection is canceled.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TimeBetweenActiveWindowChanges
histogram.summary: The amount of time between endings of overview mode sessions which were caused by the user selecting a window which was not previously active. Only recorded on the second and later times after startup that the user selected a window which was not previously active.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TimeBetweenUse
histogram.summary: The amount of time between uses of overview mode, recorded when overview mode is entered. Only recorded on the second and later times after startup that the user entered overview mode.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TimeInOverview
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in overview mode. Overview mode is engaged by pressing the overview button. The time is measured from the moment the windows begin animating to a thumbnail size preview to when a window is selected or selection is canceled.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.TimeInOverviewWithTextFiltering
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2021 as of https://crrev.com/c/2816339. The text filtering feature has been removed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in overview mode when text filtering is used. The time is measured from the moment the windows begin animating to a thumbnail size preview to when a window is selected or selection is canceled. Only recorded if the text filtering textfield contains a non-empty string.

histogram.name: Ash.WorkspaceWindowResizer.TabDragging.PresentationTime.ClamshellMode
histogram.summary: Presentation time in ms when a tab is dragged in clamshell mode. Each time the tab is dragged within a display, the time it takes to present the new frame on screen is recorded.

histogram.name: Ash.WorkspaceWindowResizer.TabDragging.PresentationTime.MaxLatency.ClamshellMode
histogram.summary: Maximum presentation time recorded during the tab dragging session.
